conclusion: Analyze the motion of the small ball and forces using conservation of energy and Newton's laws.
Determine the speed of the ball at the highest point P.
The ball starts with an initial velocity v0 = 4 m/s vertically upwards.
At the highest point P, the ball has both translational and rotational kinetic energy.
Using conservation of energy equation: 1/2 m v0^2 + 1/2 I ω^2 = 1/2 m vP^2 + 1/2 I ωP^2.
At the highest point P, translational speed vP of the ball and angular speed ωP of the ball.
Since vP is zero, equation simplifies to: 1/2 m v0^2 = 1/2 I ωP^2.
Determine the force exerted by the ball on the rod.
At the highest point P, the ball experiences tension T in the rod and gravitational force mg.
Net force along radial direction must balance centripetal force: T + mg = m vP^2 / L.
Magnitude of force exerted by the ball on the rod is |T| = 10 N.
Direction of the force is downwards (towards the center of the circle).
Final answer: Magnitude of force is 10 N, direction is downwards.
